title-group.article-title: Field Facial Injuries and Study of Their Simulation with Dummy

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1982 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: With drivers wearing 3-point seat belts, the head-steering-wheel impact occurs in mostserious accidents, so inducing mainly face injuries. In a first part, the authors analyze the injuries observed in a sample of 1180 belted drivers involved in frontal collisions, making a distinction, mainly for facial impacts, between injuries related to the properly socalled face and those to the skull and brain and the different possible lesional correlation. In a second part are presented the results of work carried out in order to define a human face model adaptable to anytype of Hybrid II or Hybrid III dummies' heads. The use of this model allows one to elaborate a new protection criterion, the head and skull protection criterion, such as the HI (or another equivalent criterion which could possibly replace it).
